newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Newman Overseas says Denway bid complete.
newsitem.headline: Newman Overseas says Denway bid complete.

text.p: Newman Overseas Ltd and Denway Investment Ltd said on Tuesday they had completed a HK$0.465 per share cash offer from Newman for a 72.8 percent stake of Denway on January 20.

The joint announcement said Newman would acquire a 55.4 percent Denway stake from China Lounge Investment Ltd, a subsidiary of Guangzhou Jinda Motors Holdings Enterprises, and a 17.4 percent stake from Hero China Investment Ltd, a subsidiary of Yue Xiu Enterprises (Holdings) Ltd.
Newman, whose sole business function is the holding of the Denway stake, is indirectly held by Yue Xiu and Guangzhou Jinda Motors.
Yue Xiu and Guangzhou Jinda Motors were both established as investment companies by the Guangzhou municipal government.
Newman announced on January 13 that it planned to bid for Denway, conditional on completion of a share restructuring between Newman and Denway shareholders.
The offer price represented a 39.6 percent discount to the closing price of HK$0.77 on January 6, when the shares were suspended.
